item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

@echo off title Compiler "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java\jdk1.6.0_**/bin/javac.exe" *.java @echo You have compiled the Server. pause

Change the ** to current JDK version.

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

Try my compiler

@echo off title compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

If not,

You can always compile from the command line.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @ags_god ags god
item.description:
@ags_god wrote:

@echo off
@TITLE
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Thats my current compiler code but it won’t work says You do not have java installed blah blah but I am on windows seven and 64 bit and usually it had (x86)
Can anyone fix so i can compile??

Read full topic
